Name: Gwyneth de Guia
universityAnswer: UQ, Bachelor of Engineering (Hons)/Master of Engineering majoring in mechatronics, 3rd Year
whyStudyAnswer: I love being able to give back to communities and have a positive impact on othersâ€™ everyday lives and I believe that engineering allows me to use my brain and skills to help the less fortunate in our society. Helping disadvantaged people in the world with my ideas and creations is the drive behind all the studying for this degree.
dreamJobAnswer: My dream job is to work in the prosthetics industry. In the future I would love to contribute to the joy and excitement of people who are able to see or hear or walk for the first time.
whyRobogalsAnswer: I joined Robogals because I wanted to be part of a group of intelligent and like-minded women who encouraged others to pursue STEM. I love the workshops they do and I want to give young girls the opportunity to consider STEM as a future career path which is something I was never able to experience.
appliedStemAnswer: Similar to my dream job, I love prosthetic limbs - anything that enables humans to achieve more than what they were initially able to is absolutely incredible.
funFactsAnswer: English is my passion and I would love to pursue that as a hobby in the future.
